thread.title: Chanel takes Paris Fashion Week to new heights with rocket launch
thread.title_full: Chanel takes Paris Fashion Week to new heights with rocket launch

author: USA TODAY
title: Chanel takes Paris Fashion Week to new heights with rocket launch
text:
Chanel takes Paris Fashion Week to new heights with rocket launch Jaleesa M. Jones , USA TODAY Published 9:32 a.m. ET March 7, 2017 | Updated 10 minutes ago 
#HiddenFashion? (Photo: Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images) 
Someone’s been watching Hidden Figures . 
Chanel’s head designer, Karl Lagerfeld, evoked memories of the Space Race and the women of NASA with an interstellar-themed Paris Fashion Week presentation — and the ending was a blast. Literally. 
As part of the finale to the Thursday show, Lagerfeld coordinated the launch of a massive Chanel "Space Agency" rocket ship to the tune of Elton John's Rocket Man . The demonstration was complete with smoke and faux sparks, which had the crowd inside Paris’ Grand Palais seeing stars. 
Of course, it helped that actual stars were in the building, including runway stars Kendall Jenner and Gigi and Bella Hadid, Vogue editor-in-chief Anna Wintour and Chanel muses Lily Rose-Depp , Cara Delevingne and Pharrell . Relive the lift-off below. A post shared by Bruno Astuto (@brunoastuto) on Mar 7, 2017 at 2:39am PST A post shared by lvdorat (@lvdorat) on Mar 7, 2017 at 3:32am PST A post shared by | Australian Style Institute | (@australianstyleinstitute) on Mar 7, 2017 at 3:55am PST A post shared by Les Relookeuses (@lesrelookeuses) on Mar 7, 2017 at 5:35am PST Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. A highlight of Paris Fashion Week's seventh day was Rihanna's Fenty X Puma collection, with the singer greeting the crowd after the models' final walk. ALAIN JOCARD, AFP/Getty Images The first model to hit the runway went topless in a plaid coat and shorts. ALAIN JOCARD, AFP/Getty Images The rest of the collegiate-inspired collection featured pleated skirts and creative takes on other school-uniform staples. ALAIN JOCARD, AFP/Getty Images Meanwhile, model Cara Delevingne made faces at photographers in the front row. ALAIN JOCARD, AFP/Getty Images Stella McCartney kicked off Paris Fashion Week's seventh day with workwear-ready looks in neutral hues, with occasional splashes of color and sparkle. Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Stella McCartney's designs always make sustainability a priority, and her most recent line featured cruelty-free takes on leather and suede. Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Instead of a traditional final walk, the models staged a sweet tribute to George Michael, singing and dancing to the late singer's hit 'Faith.' Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Among the celebrity attendees at Stella McCartney: Salma Hayek. Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Pamela Anderson also showed off a toned-down look at the show. Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Dreamily romantic gowns were a staple of Giambattista Valli's PFW presentation. Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Also seen on the runway: this street style-ready patterned dress. Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Also seen on the runway: this street style-ready patterned dress. Pascal Le Segretain, Getty Images Alexander McQueen's PFW show was a contrast in darkness... FRANCOIS GUILLOT, AFP/Getty Images
